website_summaries.verdict: The mirrorless Fujifilm X-T20 delivers the same image quality and focus capabilities as the pricier X-T2, but drops weather sealing and some other pro features to hit a lower price point.
cons: Omits in-body stabilization and weather sealing
4K footage suffers from rolling shutter effect

customer_reviews.title: Fuji changing the game
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. To give a bit of background I went Sony A6000, Sony A7ii and then to this x-t20. Going from the full frame Sony to this crop sensor fuji has really sparked my passion for photography again. The lens line up is very impressive in terms of price and quality. It's a cheaper system than the Sony but with much higher usability and quality. What else could you want?
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lake

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking camera, the retro style looks are just fantastic and always get plenty comments. Focus is fast and simple in auto mode and manual. Multi detection zones are easy to use and makes framing a shot easy too. The auto modes are plentiful and very good results can be obtained by using them without any extra settings. On the bad side some of the controls are a little close together and easy to touch by accident, menus are somewhat crowded and take a bit of getting used to. Spend the time setting up your own personal shortcuts and it really speeds up some of the manual selections.
customer_reviews.author: marc tough

customer_reviews.title: A little gem.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is well underrated. I have owned many DSLRs and needed something smaller that could produce good images. I was not disappointed with the results and quality this camera gave me. The XF 18-55 kit lens is as good as my canon L series glass. The compact size and great features offer not only amateurs but professionals a good solid performing compact camera.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Neen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera, Fuji at its best
customer_reviews.text: On par with XT2 focus speed but smaller to hold. It's a fantastic camera that produces the best jpg files you will find from any camera manufacturer. Not much to say other than its perfect for families who want a bit more from their cameras.
customer_reviews.author: MR Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent photo quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model because I've had an x-t20 which has performed very well. Unfortunately, that model has broken. I hope the new model lasts rather longer. Takes excellent photos, autofocus performs reasonably well. Peak view very helpful in manual mode. Not water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hutton

customer_reviews.title: What a load of junk!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Fujifim camera, having previously owned low end DSLRs from Canon and Nikon. I am returning this and gaining to get an equivalent priced Nikon. The autofocus is awful, kit lens is shockingly bad quality and picture quality is below that of my Galaxy S9 phone. Its going right back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant camera
customer_reviews.text: The pictures are super crisp! If you're are a beginner or swapping from Canon/Sony, it might seem confusing, as there are a lot of things you can customise, but once you get used to the layout, it's brilliant. Super lightweight, really stylish - brilliant camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best camera for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Best camera for the money! Great walk around with professional result. The 18-55 lens is a gem for the price and it can produce images of prime quality.
customer_reviews.author: Criss

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera and lens
customer_reviews.text: This proved to be a great camera and this lens (16-50) is much better than expected. Even the 4 K video is fine and far better than some of the reviews I have read. All in all I am very pleased . What I really like is the easy use of manual controls.
customer_reviews.author: Postman

customer_reviews.title: Best bargin in photography
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant little mirrorless camera. If you're looking to get into the fuji system this is a cracking little camera to do it with. It punches way over it's weight. Outstanding value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Dinage

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, like it so far. There are a few minor things, but it's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Oleg

customer_reviews.title: No UK charging plug included!
customer_reviews.text: This item didn’t come with a UK charger...and only had a European two prong plug. So now I’ll be unable to use over the festive period.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.text: Great value now that this model is about 3 years old and has now been updated...
customer_reviews.author: trevor woodford

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Camera, bought for holidays,walks etc. Love the features and custom menu options. Good lens, Brilliant picture quality. Buy extra batteries you'll need them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality images
customer_reviews.text: Sharp pictures and a sturdy build which make for a very good camera overall. Only downside is the battery, which doesn't have the best endurance.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Bland

customer_reviews.title: Sent the wrong colour and comes with a European plug
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, but the wrong one was sent and I had to buy a UK compatible battery pack
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Fuji is famous with their pictures
customer_reviews.text: Good camera for that low price. Love it! Bought without lens.
customer_reviews.author: Jakovs

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but not worth the upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Yes it’s got loads of features and looks great. I got it to replace my Canon EOS 750D, but I have to say after 2 days of thorough investigation and 100’s of photos taken in Fine/RAW Manual and JPEG Auto , I didn’t think the picture quality was as good as my old Canon and certainly not worth the £1000 to upgrade. Battery life was awful and a day out with the Fuji and you’re going to need 2 or 3 batteries. So I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: Not a mini T2
customer_reviews.text: Good little brother to the T2 but nowhere near the same build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cibble10

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, inadequate packing by Amazon UK
customer_reviews.text: This is a brilliant mirrorless camera (we now have two of them used with Fujinon 18-55 mm & 100-400 mm) that we use for wildlife and landscape. HOWEVER Amazon UK shipped this £750 fragile item in a close fitting cardboard box/sleeve without ANY impact absorbing material around it whatsover; not even a simple twist of scrunched up paper! Thank goodness it was body-only and not an OIS lens or DSLR which would not have survived bouncing around on flloor of the courier's van.
customer_reviews.author: Regor

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I didn't use it much for a start as it is difficult to get used to the controls after using a Nikon for many years, but now I have used it for a photo holiday I have fallen in love with it.
customer_reviews.author: J B.

customer_reviews.title: Amateur photographer
customer_reviews.text: After 3 weeks of usage the only draw back that I have identified is that it can be small in the hands. Although I have small hands, I hit very often the back buttons entering in the menu unwillingly. Otherwise a truly perfect camera for my use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly Biezel over the on and off switch loose!
customer_reviews.text: Any one know if the Biezel which sits over the ‘On and Off’ Switch, Is it supposed to move?, ie as if it’s supposed to be loose?.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hadley

customer_reviews.title: Well worthwhile purchase
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this camera especially image quality. I recommend it to anyone who does not have huge hands because some controls are so close together. Perhaps even this can be overcome by setting up clever shortcuts.
customer_reviews.author: Andries Martin

customer_reviews.title: What a machine!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing camera,performs far beyond my expectations. Great quality and started to add new lenses. Only thing is protect it as it a bit fragile! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John Alderson

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Camera
customer_reviews.text: Having tried several SLRs and struggled to get on with them (focussing issues primarily) i invested in an XT20 and i am very impressed. Focussing is instantaneous and it's control of exposure is remarkable. In auto mode it is close to perfect plus you have full control in manual mode. I took one photo in a dim room with 1/40 sec hand held and it used 6400 ISO. There was hardly a trace of noise and the result was well exposed and clear. Amazing! Results have been clear and very sharp with the supplied kit lens.
customer_reviews.author: MikeMargate

customer_reviews.title: Magnific product
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases of my life. The image quality of a professional SLR in the body of a compact. Superbe.
customer_reviews.author: francesco

customer_reviews.title: Good camera but...
customer_reviews.text: I will start off by saying that this is a good camera nice picture quality very well built and has nice but expensive lens options for future upgrades. The menu is alright my wifi stopped working within two months but firmware is good The biggest drawback is the viewfinder it's just too small now I have not tried the Xpro 2 or the XT2 but the XT20 /10 has way to small of a viewfinder too be used properly and for that reason I have made it a 3 star review.... Pity because if not for the tiny viewfinder and the faulty wifi it would have been a 5
customer_reviews.author: Geffen S.

product_meta.title: Fujifilm X-T20 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:Black| Style Name:Camera Body OnlyThe compact and lightweight FUJIFILM X-T20 comes complete with APS-C sized 24.3MP X-Trans CMOS III sensor and X-Processor Pro image processing engine. The updated sensor and processor, along with a reworked AF algorithm, boost the camera’s start-up time and AF performance, dramatically improving its ability to track moving subjects, while the tilting touchscreen LCD monitor enables users to shoot from a variety of angles with ease. The X-T20 also has enhanced video functionality and is capable of capturing 4K movies with Fujifilm’s popular Film Simulation modes. Staying true to the X Series functional design ethos, the X-T20 also combines an SLR-style viewfinder and dial-based operation.
